verses.roman:
hāsyo 'dbhutas tathā vīraḥ
karuṇo raudra ity api
bhayānakaḥ sa bībhatsa
iti gauṇaś ca saptadhā

synonyms: hāsyaḥ—laughter; adbhutaḥ—wonder; tathā—then; vīraḥ—chivalry; karuṇaḥ—compassion; raudraḥ—anger; iti—thus; api—also; bhayānakaḥ—fear; saḥ—that; bībhatsaḥ—disaster; iti—thus; gauṇaḥ—indirect; ca—also; sapta-dhā—seven kinds.
translation: "Besides the five direct mellows, there are seven indirect mellows, known as laughter, wonder, chivalry, compassion, anger, disaster and fear.

purport.content: This verse is found in the Bhakti-rasāmṛta-sindhu (2.5.116).
